name: Hermes' Caduceus
description:
The opposing serpents of the Hermes' Caduceus represent opposing forces that can associate but not be confused. The two also represent the symbol of the balance between antagonistic forces and infinity. The one on the right is called Od, which represents life freely directed; the one on the left Ob, fatal and smart life.

Another symbol of Hermes is his winged shoes, a pair of winged shoes forged by Hephaestus and delivered to the messenger god of Olympus. Since then, they have been used by Hermes or by whoever he finds worthy.

"A story about the world? Yes, yes, we know one"
This is how the journey of the artists to show their vision about the Greek Gods and their form begins.

Part of the #Cryptoamigues #CryptOlimpianos a collaborative event by artists based in Brazil.

1000x1000 300 dpi | Art by @carlinbrt | 2021 | CSP
